column4: Hi, i´m trying to boot my workstations from an nfs server, but i always get a kernel panic, just as described on https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/181258
ahha, I use root over NFS
It's network manager getting in the way last time I checked
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/OnNFSDriveWithLocalBoot <-- the stuff about network manager might help you there
thx, but it does not solve the problem
that's the exact same message I got before fiddling with network mangler.... maybe something else is messing with your eth0?
i´l retry from scratch, maybe i did something wrong
no luck, i created a new install on my nfs server with debootstrap, and still the same error message. Networkmanager is not even installed
It's definiately something which is messing with your ethernet though - that's the message I got when eth0 was brought down and back up again, of course losing connection with the NFS server ;)
should i fix this to nfs?
you ought to set that to BOOT=nfs, yeah
I wrote the NFS with local boot howto, and that worked okay for me
